common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch on startup
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS getting stuck on "ensure core dependencies" screen. This affected both MacOS and Windows users. Updating to the latest version (11.1.1 or 11.1.2) often resolved the issue. Providing user logs aided in diagnosis. In some cases, the issue stemmed from stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1, addressed in the 11.1.2 patch.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of the Conversation:

* **Problem:** PiecesOS fails to start up and get stuck on "ensure core dependencies". 
* **Affected Users:** 
    * Shamas-Habib (Windows) - Initially, PiecesOS didn't appear in the tray. 
    * JasonDWilson (MacOS) - PiecesOS launches a webpage stating it cannot start and restarts don't solve the issue.
    * rogierlegit (MacOS) - PiecesOS seems stuck at step 1 with a blank user interface, though appearing to run in the background.
* **Troubleshooting:** 
    * Windows: 
        * Reinstall PiecesOS using the appInstaller build.
        * Provide user logs from: `c:/Users/{USERNAME}/Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs`
        * Investigate if Atlas OS affects the issue.
        * Reinstall Windows and check if it resolves the issue.
    * MacOS: 
        * Update to the latest version (11.1.1 or 11.1.2).
        * Provide user logs.
* **Resolution:**
    * For most users, updating to version 11.1.1 resolved the issue. 
    * JasonDWilson's problem was solved after addressing a long-standing issue with OneDrive.
    * rogierlegit's problem was likely resolved by simply closing and re-opening the app, though the issue was acknowledged by the Pieces team and a patch was released for the desktop app (3.3.8).
* **Current Status:**
    * All users seem to have their issues resolved.

## Other points:

* Some users were initially confused about how to provide user logs or open new issues.
* Shamas-Habib's initial attempt to resolve their issue involved taking over rogierlegit's issue, leading to confusion.

## Conclusion:

The communication effectively addressed the user concerns, identified the problem, and offered solutions. It also highlighted the importance of clear communication, proper user guidance, and acknowledging user feedback for continuous improvement.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user expressed gratitude for the help received.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crash due to missing AVX2 support
common_issues.description: PiecesOS versions 11.1.1 had a bug causing crashes on launch for systems lacking AVX2 support. This affected macOS and Windows users. The issue stemmed from a new vector library with stricter hardware requirements. Pieces released version 11.1.2 with a fix, resolving the issue for users with compatible CPUs.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User reported issue with PiecesOS not launching on macOS due to AVX2 support issues.
* User provided system information and CPU details.
* Pieces support team acknowledged the issue and mentioned a new release with a fix.

**Problems Identified:**

* New vector library had AVX2 issues on certain systems.
* Older CPUs (pre-2016/2017) without AVX2 support were affected.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team released a new version (11.1.2) with a fix for the AVX2 issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved for users with compatible CPUs after updating to version 11.1.2.

**Additional notes:**

* Users with older CPUs (pre-2016/2017) will not be able to use the latest version of PiecesOS.

Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Issue Summary for GitHub Issue #620: Pieces OS Won't Run

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `GetReal444` reported an issue with Pieces OS not booting up.
* Logs indicated an error due to missing AVX2 hardware support.

**Problems Identified:**

* The database service required AVX2 hardware support, which was missing on some user machines.
* This caused the application to fail to boot.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team investigated the issue and determined it was impacting multiple users.
* A solution to address the failing dependency of the AVX2 vector library was identified and implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A patch was released in Version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS to resolve the issue.
* The user confirmed that the issue was resolved after updating to the latest version.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was related to other reported issues (#624 and #625).
* The Pieces team actively worked on a solution and communicated updates to the affected users.

This issue primarily affected version 11.1.1. The Pieces team released a patch in version 11.1.2 to resolve this issue. Users experiencing this problem are advised to upgrade to the latest version.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS 11.1.1 fails to launch on some systems
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS 11.1.1 failing to launch, particularly on Mac with Apple Silicon and some Windows machines. This was attributed to stricter hardware requirements in the 11.1.1 update. The issue was addressed in version 11.1.2, encouraging users to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key Points:** * The author, mark-at-pieces, posted a comment stating that the issue is resolved. * No further details are provided about the issue or the resolution. **Problems Identified:** * The initial issue that prompted the conversation is not described. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * No solutions are proposed or mentioned as implemented. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is marked as resolved, but the specific resolution remains unclear.

Suggested solutions include checking internet connection, verifying firewall settings, ensuring PiecesOS dependencies are met, and reviewing logs for detailed error messages.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@rohanrathi99) reported issues with PiecesOS:
    * Unable to make requests to cloud services
    * Trouble with local models
* Support bot (@pieces-support-bot) suggested related issues and resources.
* Support engineer (@mark-at-pieces) joined the conversation:
    * Suspected firewall or network configuration issue.
    * Requested logs for further diagnosis.
    * Offered real-time debugging via calendar link.

**Problems Identified:**

* Network connectivity issues preventing communication with Pieces cloud services.
* Potential problems with local models.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review related issues and resources.
* Provide logs for com.pieces.os && com.pieces.pfd.
* Schedule real-time debugging session.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User has not yet responded with logs or scheduled a debugging session.
* Issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on February 16th and 18th, 2025.
* The user's name is assumed to be Rohan Rathi based on the username (@rohanrathi99).

**Keywords:**

* PiecesOS
* Cloud services
* Network connectivity
* Local models
* Logs
* Debugging

related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** MR-AAYU reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching.

**Key points raised:**

* MR-AAYU described the issue and provided additional details.
* Bot suggested three related issues that might be helpful.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS failed to launch on MR-AAYU's device.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The issue was automatically routed to the designated Pieces team member.
* Bot suggested relevant resources and documentation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is being handled by the Pieces team.
* MR-AAYU has been asked to wait for a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Concise summary:**

MR-AAYU reported an issue where PiecesOS was not launching. The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team and MR-AAYU was encouraged to explore resources and wait for a follow-up. The current status is pending resolution by the Pieces team.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of launch issues:** The most frequent and active tickets revolve around PiecesOS launch failures. Focus on identifying the root causes and implementing permanent fixes.
**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** Clearly communicate the minimum hardware requirements for PiecesOS, especially AVX2 support, to prevent installation and launch issues.
**Enhance error messaging and logging:** Provide more informative error messages to users and ensure detailed logs are generated to aid in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Develop a troubleshooting guide for connectivity problems:** Create a comprehensive guide for users experiencing connectivity issues with cloud services, covering network configuration, firewall settings, and dependency checks.

**Investigate and address issues with Pieces for Developers:** Several tickets indicate problems with Pieces for Developers, including cloud service access and local LLM usage. Investigate these issues thoroughly and provide timely solutions.

**Consider a more robust hardware check during installation:** Implement a system check during installation to detect incompatible hardware and alert users before installation to prevent subsequent launch problems.
**Proactively monitor for similar issues:** Develop a system to monitor support tickets for recurring issues and prioritize addressing them to prevent widespread user impact.
**Improve discoverability of existing resources:** Ensure users can easily find relevant documentation, FAQs, and troubleshooting guides to encourage self-service resolution for common problems.
**Gather user feedback on error messages and support experience:** Collect feedback from users on the clarity of error messages and their overall support experience to identify areas for improvement.
